moze byc ale nie chca mi zaufac

I've now played over 40 hours. I now only rarely end up last on the leaderboards. But I still feel like a noob.

That's, in a nutshell, what's great about this game, for me. Because I'm getting better, but still far from good. At first, you're just constantly dying and doing things wrong. The community can be unforgiving (but that's okay. just keep trying). If you keep on trying you will become a good team member, covering this or that, helping here and there to win.

I would have loved to be told early on that practicing shooting with different weapons is key to mastering this game. Every weapon is different and needs to be shot/used differently. Once you know where the bullets go, where the recoil takes you, you'll start being able to actually hit opponents regularly. Just use a map with bots and have fun practicing.

I know I'll never be a great player. But I know I can be good, someday. I'll keep on shooting, because this game is fun.
